data.title: Been going here since high school
data.text: This place is a favorite for everyone. Joe and Sue Cobb opened this place many many years ago and Sue is still here. Her husband passed away.  Everyone loves Sue and Sue loves everyone.  Excellent barbeque and always fresh.  It is a fun place to go and see local friends-you always run in to someone.  I am 59 years old and I started going here in the early 70's.  My old high school is across the street and ate many a lunch here during those days!  We get Thanksgiving turkeys and Christmas turkeys every year.  All of food is amazing.  I highly recommend Joe Cobbs-A tradition!

data.title: great BBQ
data.text: every time I'm in town I stop at Cobbs bbq its  been there over 60 years for a reason I always get the chopped with cheese and its always killer thanx Sue

data.title: Total Letdown
data.text: Went with my family for a Saturday lunch.  Place was empty, we should of been forewarned, but we read all the glowing reviews on TA, so we decided to give it a try.  We had beef and pork sandwiches, the meat had no flavor at all, no smoke, heat or any normal bbq flavors.  The sauce tasted like vinegar mixed with catsup, awful. My daughter ordered a pork sandwich, but the meat tasted like turkey.  Not sure how this place got all of its glowing reviews, but we wont ever go back!

data.title: This is one of the oldest establishments in town.
data.text: They have some of the best food for it's kind. This is a family owned  restaurant and they will make sure you are really taken care of.

data.title: Good food!!!
data.text: I stopped here one day to have a quick lunch, and the food was really good.  The staff are friendly and I did not wait too long for my food. This is a little place with Big food. lol...I was very happy that I tried the food.

data.title: Great old fashion bbq place.
data.text: No much to look at but good food and really good prices. Counter service, nothing fancy about it. Been in business over 50 years says it all. The food is good. I had a nice turkey sandwich and potato salad. It was great and folks are friendly.

data.title: Not What it Used to Be
data.text:
Sad to say it, but Cobb's has lost it's mojo with what used to be good Bar-B-Q.  My last visit will be my last because of the gooey, almost paste-like spread of what is supposed to be chopped beef is merely a very small portion of a pitiful tasting light spread of meat-flavored paste.  Pretty yucky stuff to be truthful.

The sides are also very small and served in small cups.

Do everyone a favor and shutter the place.

data.title: Eat here and meet the owner
data.text: Small place off the road/ close the to our hotel. Great prices and good food. Down home barbeque with all the sides. I loved the sauce and talking to Ms. Sue, the . owner who says she is there everyday. Opened in 1952 with pictures of Mr. Joe and Ms Sue all over the wall. I don't think anything has changed!

data.title: Damn good for the price
data.text: I've been there quite a few times and every time the food is delicious!!!  The place is admittedly run down a bit, but once you talk to the owner, Mrs. Cobb, and get the back story, you'll find the place charming and homey.  Also, the cleanliness of the place may not be 100% (not dirty, just not as clean as it could be) but I've never had any sort of problem with my food because of it.  The sandwiches and beans espically are my favorites!!  Recommend

data.title: BBQ with history
data.text: This is the best BBQ you will find anywhere! Now, I know the location looks run down, but that has nothing on the food itself. After chatting with the owner, Sue Cobb, who's husband started the place over 60 years ago, you really get a great feeling about the love that goes into the food and service. Take a stroll around the restaurant and look at the pictures that have been put up over those years, including stars, dignitaries, politicians, you name it! A real can't miss place to grab a bite in the Shreveport/Bossier City area.

data.title: Best BBQ Sandwich In Town!
data.text: Joe Cobb's BBQ is an institution in the Shreveport/Bossier City area. It has been the home of great BBQ for many years and still delivers today. My wife and I stopped here while on vacation. The chopped BBQ beef sandwich was AMAZING and the potato salad was a great compliment to the meal. Combine the food with a wonderful atmosphere and friendly staff and you have a great dining experience. Joe Cobb's BBQ is one of those down home, known-to-locals restaurants that is just a treat every time you eat there. Whenever I'm in the area, Joe Cobb's is one place I always stop at.

data.title: Don"t Do It
data.text: Well my husband and I was staying at the comfort inn right around the corner from Joe Cobb BBQ so we decided to take a chance. The place was empty which should have gave us a clue. But we were giving them the benefit of a doubt. We ordered 2 bbq sandwiches and when I saw the lady prepare it without gloves that did it for me. I"m thinking $2.50 for a BBQ sandwich was a steal. When we got back to the room and unwrapped my sandwich i could see why it was so cheap because it was so small. As big as a Mcdouble at Mcdonalds. When I tasted it I couldn't understand why some of the previous reviews spoke highly of this place. Never again. Some of the worst tasting BBQ I have ever had. I could have done better myself.

data.title: Great Bar-B-Que!
data.text: This is without a doubt the best Bar-B-Que you will find anywhere. Be forewarned, there are not frills, just good food. All the home town people have been eating here for 40-50 years, and on any given day the place will be full of local people. If you love good food, you won't be disappointed to eat  at Joe  Cobbs.

data.title: Must try
data.text: If youve never been to Cobbs you must go. 60 plus years in business. Love their potato salad and po boys! Not much on their actual bbq but the place is one of the most unique places in our area! Get out of the franchises and support local!

data.title: Good Old Fashioned BBQ Joint
data.text: Joe Cobb Bar-B-Q is a Bossier City staple.  The atmosphere is what you expect from an old fashioned BBQ joint, the service and the food are on par with the atmosphere a bit run-down but good.  Worth a visit if you haven't!

data.title: My 50th reunion review...
data.text: OK, I have been back to Bossier City (Oct. 2-6) and ate at Cobb's TWICE.  Still the same good food.  Miss Sue was there when my class met for lunch.  She's as sweet and friendly as ever.  Sean was behind the counter serving up the best BBQ in town.  I had the ribs, a departure from my usual chopped beef sandwiches.  Loved it back in the 1960's and love it now.

data.title: A HAVE TO Stop in Bossier
data.text:
Nestled in the middle of Bossier City LA is a GEM that should be discovered by all. 

Over 50 years ago a young man by the name of Joe Cobb made a deal with a family member to open a small Bar B Que shop, and he had a dream. 

Since the 1950's, Cobb's Bossier City Bar-B-Q has been opened for business at 203 McCormick Street off of Barksdale Boulevard in Bossier City LA and I am here to tell you, the ONLY thing that has changed is the fact that the cost of eating has gone up a little since you could buy 5 for a Dollar.

This small business with the big heart and bigger taste has been a family owed business since day 1 and what comes with that is something that you cannot get from the big chain stores: REAL down home cooking and true Customer Service. 

Inside the doors of this small venue, that pretty much has been kept looking exactly like it was fifty years ago, is some of the finest Bar-B-Q in the state of Louisiana if not the entire country. 

Still made the way it was back then and with no hoopla or frills, this jewel has been serving generations of locals and lucky travelers such as myself great food at great prices still today. 

From the beautiful pictures of Joe and his wife that hang on the wall to the many other classic articles and pictures on the walls and then watching your sliced beef or ham actually get sliced right in front of you while you wait, is a great feel and taste. 

If you happen to wander into Bossier and cannot find this small venue hidden away from the hustle and bustle of the city around it, just ask anyone where it is. Good luck and good eats are in your future here

data.title: Old Fashioned B-B-Q
data.text: Wishing a sandwich for lunch we did not want cold cuts deli style.  I knew Cobb's had  been there for years.  The chopped beef and turkey sandwiches were just what was wanted and they were smoked just right.   They were generous and the sauce was good.  If you go check out  the many pictures on the wall.  It is a favorite of Barksdale air force airmen.

data.title: Not My Favorite
data.text: I agree with some other reviews that the sauce leaves something to be desired. It's too thin for my liking but the place had a steady steam of people in and out so maybe it's just not my taste.

data.title: Down home BBQ and friendly people
data.text: I grew up eating lunch at this little "mom & pop" restaurant and have not found any better BBQ!  The BBQ, beans, potato salad are great, simple and satisfying.  The staff are the same friendly people from 20 years ago and will chat you up if your interested in a conversation. Try the sliced turkey BBQ sandwich if you get a chance to go to Joe Cobb's.
